caption:
Table 1. Comparison on Sub-JHMDB [23] dataset with existing video-based 
efficient methods [41,59,10] for 2D pose estimation. R stands for ResNet back-
bone [16]. Ratio represents the sampling ratio. The pose estimator of DeciWatch is the 
single-frame model SimplePose (R50) [51]. Best results are in bold.

Table 2. Comparing DeciWatch with existing single-image 3D pose esti-
mators on Human3.6M [22], 3DPW [38], and AIST++ [34] datasets. Pose 
estimators used in DeciWatch keep the same as the corresponding methods.

Table 4. Comparison of MPJPE with traditional interpolation methods on 
AIST++ dataset

Table 5. Comparison of MPJPE 
with different sampling strategies on 
3DPW dataset with EFT [25] pose es-
timator (MPJPE is 90.3mm). U.-2 and 
U.-3 are uniform sampling 2 or 3 frames for 
every N frames. U.-R. conducts both uni-
form sampling and random sampling. R. is 
random sampling. 
Ratio U.(Ours) U.-2 U.-3 U.-R. R.

Table 6. Exploring impacts of the two DenoiseNet and RecoverNet subnets 
with 10% sampling ratio on three dataset and the corresponding backbones. 
Ori. means the original estimator (watching all frames) with 100% sampling ratio. No 
RecoverNet is preliminarily recovered via a temporal linear layer.

Table 1. Comparison of MPJPE on efficient pose labeling that labels one 
frame in every N frames on Human3.6M [22] and AIST++ [34] dataset.

Table 2. Comparison of DeciWatch and SimplePose[51] on PCK@0.2, 
PCK@0.1, and PCK@0.05. In future work, we recommend using PCK@0.05 as 
the main metrics for 2D pose estimation.

Table 3. Cross-backbone and cross-dataset results from DeciWatch check-
points trained on 3DPW-PARE.

Table 5. Comparison results with different denoise network designs on 3DPW dataset 
with the state-of-the-art pose estimator Pare [29] (MPJPE is 78.9mm).

Table 6. Comparison results with different recovery network designs on 
3DPW dataset with the state-of-the-art pose estimator PARE [29](MPJPE is 78.9mm).

Table 7. Comparison results of different loss weight ? on 3DPW dataset with 
the state-of-the-art pose estimator Pare [29](MPJPE is 78.9mm).

Table 8. Comparison results of different embedding dimension C on 3DPW 
dataset with the state-of-the-art pose estimator Pare [29].
